name: Los Gatos Salvajes
description: '''Los Gatos Salvajes,''' from [[Rosario, Santa Fe]] in [[Argentina]], were a [[Beat music|beat]] and [[garage rock]] band active in the early to mid-1960s, following which members Litto Nebbia and Ciro Fogliatta would go on to form the later, more successful group, [[Los Gatos (band)|Los Gatos]]. They were one of Argentina's first teenage rock & roll bands, and part of the popular worldwide beat movement inspired by the success of the Beatles and the British Invasion. They enjoyed only limited record sales, despite some degree of success in their television appearances, but are recognised as a pioneering group in Argentina.
